notes.highlightText: house jumped up in a gorging fire that burned the evening sky
strode in a swarm of fireflies. He wanted
great python spitting its venomous kerosene upon the world, the blood pounded in his head, and his hands
blazing and burning to bring down the tatters and charcoal

minstrel man, burnt-corked, in the mirror. Later, going to sleep, he would feel the fiery smile still gripped by his face muscles, in the dark. It never went away, that smile, it never ever went away, as long as he remembered.
      He hung up his black-beetle-coloured helmet and shined it, he hung his flameproof jacket neatly; he showered luxuriously, and then, whistling, hands in pockets, walked
